intro: Blepharodon philibertioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf blepharodon, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
